They traveled upright in collapsible shopping carts, tied to the tops of S.U.V.'s, dragged from the back of a Boy Scout troop's van and eerily wrapped like corpses in garbage bags and tablecloths. body: SHORT of pregnancy, do you ever crave the same kind of food, day after day? Maybe it's a seasonal reaction against the richness of holiday cooking, but all I've wanted for the last week or two are the uncomplicated, flavorful dishes that are the signature of Turkish cuisine. One place where I have tried to satisfy my craving is Kapadokya, a Turkish
title: $25 AND UNDER; In Brooklyn Heights, the Precise Flavors of Turkey

body: So what if the Republican convention is coming to the city? So what if the president is cutting taxes? New York area football fans knew what true deliverance meant yesterday: put the Giants back on the field and let them kick it again. Oh, the dastardly melodramatic horror of it all. title: Kicking It Over (in Their Minds); Heartbroken Giants Fans Wish in Vain for Real Replay

body: In 1774, a Yale University student named David Bushnell invented the first wooden submarine, called the Turtle. It was 7 3/5frac12 4/5 feet long and 8 feet tall, just large enough to hold one man with air for 30 minutes, and it was operated by foot pedals and hand levers.
